title: Ras El Hanout Basa & Saffron Giant Couscous Stew
keywords: Ras el hanout, Basa, Saffron, Couscous, Stew, North African, Spiced fish

method.step: Get all your ingredients and equipment ready
Skim though these steps then wash your fruit and vegetables
(Equipment and pan sizes vary, make sure you cook food thoroughly (even if it takes you a little longer than 10 minutes)
Boil a kettle and heat a large wide based pan with a drizzle olive oil over a heigh heat
Top, tail and chop your corvette(s) in half lengthways, then slice on the diagonal
Once hot, add the sliced corvette and cook for 2 minutes or until slight browned
Add your giant couscous and saffron to a pot of boiled water with a pinch of salt and bring to the boil over a heigh heat
Cook the giant couscous for 8 minutes or until tender with a slight bite then drain and return to the pot. This is your saffron giant couscous
Once the courgette is slightly browned, add your rase l hanout and roasted garlic paste and cook for 30 secs or until fragrant
Once fragrant, add you tomato paste with you chopped tomatoes and sultanas
Add your vegetable stock mix and your boiled water with a generous pinch of salt and pepper
Top with your basa fillet(s) and cook for 5 minutes, turning once half way or until the fish is cooked through and the sauce has thickened. This is your rase l hanout basa stew
Once everything is ready, add the saffron giant couscous to the stew and gently stir it all together, this is your ras el hanout basa * saffron giant couscous stew
Serve the ras el hanout basa * saffron giant couscous stew and drizzle over with your yogurt
